question.text: In vegetative propagation by tubers, which of the following remains constant through generation?

solution.text:
Vegetative propagules are the plant parts or organs that are involved in the process of reproduction even though their primary function is not it. The reproductive process is called vegetative propagation as the non-reproductive parts/organs (leaf/stem/roots) are involved. The ginger plant propagates by rhizome and grows in a horizontal direction.

The main advantage of vegetative propagation is that the genetic material is passed to the next generation, thus, the new propagules are clones of each other bear the same morphology, vigor and disease resistance as the mother plant.
